DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Glucose Electrolytes Outcome Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for glucose electrolytes, substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids and are primarily responsible for the movement of nutrients into cells and the movement of wastes out of cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for glucose electrolytes, substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids and are primarily responsible for the movement of nutrients into cells and the movement of wastes out of cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A simple sugar monosaccharide having two isoforms, alpha and beta, with a chemical structure of C6H12O6 that acts as an energy source for both plants and animals by reacting with oxygen to form Carbon Dioxide and Water, releasing energy.(NCI):(eh-LEK-tro-lites) Substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids or water.  Some examples are sodium, potassium, chloride, and calcium.  Electrolytes are primarily responsible for the movement of nutrients into cells and the movement of wastes out of cells.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A simple sugar monosaccharide having two isoforms, alpha and beta, with a chemical structure of C6H12O6 that acts as an energy source for both plants and animals by reacting with oxygen, generating carbon dioxide and water, and releasing energy.

Substances that ionize into anions and cations in body fluids.  Electrolytes regulate nerve and muscle function and water distribution between cells, plasma, and interstitial fluid.  Imbalances can cause serious physiologic effects, including seizures, cardiac arrhythmias and convulsions.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
